direct_enhancements.reason: Both methods manipulate attributes of the element, but 'removeAttr' removes an attribute while 'attr' sets or updates an attribute.
Both methods deal with attribute management, but 'clearAttributes' removes all attributes while 'removeAttr' removes a specific attribute.
Both methods handle attribute manipulation, but 'attr(String, boolean)' sets a boolean attribute, while 'removeAttr' removes an attribute.

enhanced_by.reason: The 'attributes()' method is used to access the attributes of the element, which is a prerequisite for 'removeAttr' to function.
The 'attr(String, String)' method can be used to set an attribute before it is removed by 'removeAttr', ensuring the attribute exists before removal.
The 'hasAttr(String)' method can be used to verify if the attribute was successfully removed after calling 'removeAttr'.
